meanings.definition: A day of judgment or reckoning.
meanings.sent1: On domesdays, people believe they will be judged for their actions.
meanings.sent2: The town awaited the domesdays to see who would be declared the winner.
meanings.sent3: During the domesdays, the animals in the forest held a talent show to impress the judges.
meanings.sent4: The domesdays loomed over him like a dark cloud, reminding him of his past mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The domesdays were depicted as a giant scale, weighing the good and bad deeds of each person.

meanings.sent1: The company conducted domesdays to keep track of their supplies.
meanings.sent2: The domesdays revealed a shortage of food in the pantry.
meanings.sent3: During the domesdays, the students counted all the books in the library for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a domesdays, organizing and categorizing every detail she encountered.
meanings.sent5: The domesdays of the warehouse showed a surplus of tools but a lack of raw materials.
